programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: Documentary following award-winning pool designer Lucas Congdon as he turns high and dry homes into exotic waterfront properties through grand, nature-inspired designs to encourage his clients to rediscover their love of the outdoors. The crew turns a koi pond project into a backyard oasis for a family in Siesta Key, and later transforms an old pool into a natural lagoon

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Warden Marshall leads a poaching investigation, Richards visits an illegal snake breeder and Gould and Hickerson try to save an injured pelican

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Otto and August are on a risky quest for a huge crane. Charlotte, Eivin, and Eve fight the tide to rescue a cow. And, Atz Lee and Jane go kayak fishing

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia

Documentary following the work of the SPCAs Humane Law Enforcement team, which investigates cases of animal cruelty

programme.desc: A couple ask pool designer Lucas Congdon to create a waterfront paradise in their backyard, so the crew gets to work demolishing the existing garden

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Oyster season keeps the wardens busy on the land and on water. Hunters are investigated for trespassing and a deck hand with several warrants is questioned

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: At the International Training Centre, Dr Jeff treats a stray dog suffering from a broken leg, while Hector babysits the bosss pooch Fred

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier

programme.title: A Garden in Snowdonia
programme.desc: Troy Scott continues to struggle with his task of maintaining one of the largest rhododendron collections in the country. However, Bodnant Garden faces greater trouble as reports arrive about a fast-spreading oak disease

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Narrowboater and film-maker Robbie Cumming crosses the Pennines on the picturesque Leeds and Liverpool Canal, and lends a hand to hire boaters in Gargrave, North Yorkshire. He also encounters Bingley Five Rise Locks, a wonder of the inland waterways

programme.title: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
programme.desc: An electrical repairman sees a fleet of UFOs and develops an increasing fascination with mountain-shaped forms, driving his wife to despair. Meanwhile, a single mother has a similar fixation after her son mysteriously vanishes, and a team of scientists investigates a series of strange events around the world. Eventually, they are all drawn to a mountain where aliens are about to make contact. Steven Spielbergs sci-fi drama, starring Richard Dreyfuss, Francois Truffaut and Teri Garr

programme.title: The Haunting
programme.desc: Psychic researchers gather at a supposedly haunted house to investigate its evil reputation, and find themselves facing their deepest fears as they confront the unknown forces prowling its corridors. Horror, starring Claire Bloom, Richard Johnson, Julie Harris and Russ Tamblyn

programme.title: Hauntings
programme.desc: Documentary examining paranormal activity, beginning with he Enfield Poltergeist, a series of strange events that occured at a council house in north London in 1977. Police were called to investigate reports of a burglary, but found no evidence of a break-in, but heard rapping on the walls, saw furniture tilt independently and a chair slide several metres across the room on its own. These were the first of many extraordinary events recorded on film and audio tape, culminating in disembodied voices and levitation

programme.title: Hauntings
programme.desc: A look at what occurred when Andrea Perron moved into her new home in Rhode Island with her parents and four sisters, with the previous occupants seemingly in a hurry to leave. Soon, the Perrons were experiencing multiple disturbances, hearing whispers and seeing visions prompting Andreas mother to seek help from ghost-hunters Ed and Lorraine Warren. Their investigations led to a seance, which changed the lives of the Perron family

programme.title: A Garden in Snowdonia
programme.desc: Troy Scott continues to struggle with his task of maintaining one of the largest rhododendron collections in the country. However, Bodnant Garden faces greater trouble as reports arrive about a fast-spreading oak disease

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Narrowboater and film-maker Robbie Cumming crosses the Pennines on the picturesque Leeds and Liverpool Canal, and lends a hand to hire boaters in Gargrave, North Yorkshire. He also encounters Bingley Five Rise Locks, a wonder of the inland waterways

programme.title: Blood and Gold: The Making of Spain with Simon Sebag Montefiore
programme.desc: The historian examines Spains Golden Age under Philip II through to the Spanish Civil War and dictatorship under Franco, from which Spain has emerged as a modern democratic monarchy

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 21 August 1998. Featuring Simply Red, Sweetbox, Cleopatra, Savage Garden, Babybird, Sash! feat Tina Cousins and Boyzone

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 28 August 1998. Featuring Sweetbox, Kavana, Alda, Spice Girls, Sheryl Crow, Foo Fighters, The Corrs, Robbie Williams and Boyzone

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Ed Stewart presents an episode from October 21, 1976, the second week in which Pussycats Mississippi topped the chart. The show also features performances by John Miles, Demis Roussos, Climax Blues Band, Paul Nicholas, and Steve Harley and Cockney Rebel, as well as the debut of the Top of the Pops Dancers - later to be known as Legs and Co

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Steve Wright and Caron Keating present the edition first aired on October 20, featuring performances by D Mob featuring Gary Haisman, the Christians, Enya, Deacon Blue, Milli Vanilli, Erasure, Kylie Minogue, Whitney Houston and The Wee Papa Girl Rappers

programme.title: Dolly Parton at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of archive appearances by the country superstar on the BBC, including performances of Jolene, 9 to 5, Islands in the Stream and Here You Come Again. This collection showcases the enduring songwriting talents and sense of humour that first made Dollys name back in the 1970s

programme.title: Charley Pride: In Concert
programme.desc: A concert performance by American country star Charley Pride, backed by his band, The Pridesmen. Songs include San Antone, All I Have to Offer You (Is Me) and Kaw-Liga. First broadcast 15 March 1975

programme.title: Tammy
programme.desc: Tammy Wynette sings some of her favourite songs, with guests Charlie Justice, George Hamilton IV and the Tennessee Gentlemen. First broadcast 14 September 1977

programme.title: John Denver at Wembley Arena
programme.desc: A classic performance by the US musician at Londons Wembley Arena in 1979, originally shown as part of a selection of programmes to mark the 70th year since the birth of the quintessential country boy

programme.title: Shania Twain: Live in Hyde Park
programme.desc: The queen of country-pop takes to the Hyde Park stage in 2017, performing Youre Still the One, Lifes About to Get Good, Swingin with My Eyes Closed and the crowd-pleasers That Dont Impress Me Much and Man! I Feel Like a Woman

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Jools takes a look back at some of the stars of the country scene who have performed on the show over the years. The line-up includes Johnny Cash from 1994, a duet between Emmylou Harris and Steve Earle, and Willie Nelson. The programme also features some of the new stars of country, including Taylor Swifts 2009 debut on the show, as well as Kacey Musgraves and Maren Morris

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 21 August 1998. Featuring Simply Red, Sweetbox, Cleopatra, Savage Garden, Babybird, Sash! feat Tina Cousins and Boyzone

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Top of the Pops

The show also features performances by John Miles, Demis Roussos, Climax Blues Band, Paul Nicholas, and Steve Harley and Cockney Rebel, as well as the debut of the Top of the Pops Dancers - later to be known as Legs and Co

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Steve Wright and Caron Keating present the edition first aired on October 20, featuring performances by D Mob featuring Gary Haisman, the Christians, Enya, Deacon Blue, Milli Vanilli, Erasure, Kylie Minogue, Whitney Houston and The Wee Papa Girl Rappers

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Kym Marsh present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Presenters Rav Wilding and Steph McGovern reveal how a fraudster who conned luxury hotels into buying Scottish tea was apprehended and sent to prison. They also talk to a mother whose son died riding on an e-scooter

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The three properties being bought in this edition feature family partnerships - a husband, wife and daughter team in Madeley, Shropshire, brothers-in-law in Castleton, Derbyshire, and an entire family in Newton Aycliffe, Co Durham, get stuck in. All three renovations throw up unexpected issues, but will family harmony remain intact? Presented by Martin Roberts and Martel Maxwell

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Ardingly in Sussex, where experts Raj Bisram and Nick Hall join the teams as they search for the best items to sell at auction in Newbury. Eric also brings along an unusual-looking antique and asks the fairgoers what they think it is

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: A family car fitted with a child seat is stolen off a driveway by car key burglars. As the thieves make their getaway, tracker Richard is alerted by the vehicles tiny tracking device and is quickly hot on their heels. However, theres a setback when the thieves find the cars tracker, realising its transmitting a GPS signal and that theyre being followed

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: All around the Lake District, the teams are hard at work searching for a lost possession thats been treasured for over 30 years. Crafter Sally tries to work her magic on some old ceramics rescued from the lake, while social media detective Mui strives to find a way to get a mini camera back to its owner

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse delivers the Peak District on a plate as she helps a couple from a town in Oxfordshire to find their dream country home for a budget of £450,000. While in the area, Denise also visits a family run hotel and restaurant, where she gets to sample some locally grown, seasonal delights

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Bookbinder Chris Shaw and art conservator Lucia Scalisi team up to repair a book made by two loving parents that charts the first three years of owner Lotties life. Dominic Chinea and Brenton West tackle the restoration of a paraffin camping stove bought in 1957 that comes with memories of family walking adventures and Will Kirk repairs a table bought in Thailand in the 1960s. Hatter Jayesh Vaghela fixes up a tweed flat cap for visitor Mick

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, anything between zero and £4,000. Each player only knows their own value before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve, and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Judi Love

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Roman Kemp host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Its tense between Kat and Zoe, but their attention soon turns to a cat trapped in the Vic. Zoe makes amends with her mum, but then drops a bombshell. Nigel is determined for the truth to come out, and Billy is irked when Johnny tries to win Lexis affection with gifts

programme.title: Dragons Den
programme.desc: A Newcastle-based wrestling enthusiast looks to Dragons Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Sara Davies, Steven Bartlett and Touker Suleyman to financially supplement his high-impact events business. A passionate Scottish entrepreneur showcases her line of natural tattoo aftercare products, an ed-tech innovator takes aim at the gaming generation with a platform that turns screen time into learning time, and two friends-turned-business partners pitch their safety-first flat-sharing app built on the power of mutual connections. Hosted by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: As the players gather for breakfast, their focus is solely on the game and who they can - and more importantly cannot - trust. The games continue with a mission that requires the faithful to get into the minds of a traitor - though one wrong move could prove disastrous. Back at the castle, it remains to be seen whether the faithful have gathered credible leads to topple a traitor or risk being hoodwinked further away from the truth. Hosted by Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers reviews the weeks political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Swindon to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A panel of BBC journalists hosts a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics. Laura Kuenssberg, Adam Fleming and Chris Mason are among the regular contributors

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Gaby Roslin present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Police seek help in identifying a body discovered in the Claerwen reservoir. Plus, presenters Rav Wilding and Steph McGovern take a look at some of the recent convictions from appeals featured on the programme

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A one-bedroom flat in London has a potential value of £1 million and Martel Maxwell visits 25 acres of land in Anglesey. Plus, Martin Roberts is in Bristol to see a two-bedroom flat

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley hosts from antiques fair in Oswestry, Shropshire, where Leslie Kiddell-Spencer helps a father-daughter duo and Colin Young assists a mother-daughter pair to acquire items to take to auction to make the highest possible profit. Caroline also visits a nearby 70-acre sculpture park, where she sees all sorts of wildlife made from scrap metal in the company of its founder and creator Clive Knowles

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: When a local resident is found poisoned, the method resembles that of the Good Samaritan murderer several years earlier. As the culprit for that crime is known to be in a psychiatric institution, a copycat killer is suspected. Drama, starring Lorna Watson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young canine-loving couple from Hertfordshire are hoping for a fresh start in a new High Weald home. Their budget is £600,000, so presenter Ginny Buckley soon rustles up some tempting properties to show them. Away from the houses, Ginny picks some of the local grape harvest before treating herself to a glass of fizz

programme.title: The Repair Shop on the Road
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea and Will Kirk arrive at Aberfeldys Crannog Centre, where visitors experience recreations of 5,000 year-old traditional dwellings. The duo discover how a devastating fire put a 5,000 year-old craft in jeopardy, Chris Shaw repairs a Gaelic pipe music book and Dom has the chance to make his own sporran

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, anything between zero and £4,000. Each player only knows their own value before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve, and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Judi Love

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: North Coast Riders
programme.desc: As storms lash the coast, Ethan Hill and his best mate Albert scour charts and forecasts, chasing a mythical wave that only breaks under rare winter conditions. Climber Ricky Bells protege Ricky tackles a complex boulder problem beneath Fair Head that demands precision, power and patience. Meanwhile, German-born freediver Hanno faces a quieter struggle. With tourist season over, he juggles jobs to stay afloat. His winter dives are cold, silent, and deeply personal. Beneath the grey surface, he finds clarity, connection, and the discipline that keeps him grounded

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: In south London, Nick Knowles and the team step in to help a group of siblings grieving the recent loss of their mother. Eldest siblings Somer and Samuel have taken on the enormous responsibility of being surrogate parents, doing everything they can to hold the family together. However, with five siblings squeezed into a cramped three-bedroom house, the pressure is overwhelming. To make matters harder, the youngest, Seth, who is both blind and autistic, requires a safe and supportive environment for his additional needs

programme.title: Leonard and Hungry Paul
programme.desc: During his shift as a casual postman, Hungry Paul delivers a letter to himself with good news. Leonard asks Shelley to lunch and they spend an hour together, which feels like the start of something. With a proper date planned with her for that evening, Leonard cancels his usual game night with Hungry Paul. Discombobulated, Hungry Paul goes to visit Mrs Hawthorn, but realises the chocolates bought for the hospital nurses have exceeded their sell-by date. Incensed he brings them to the local shop and demands recompense. Comedy, narrated by Julia Roberts and starring Alex Lawther and Laurie Kynaston

programme.title: Leonard and Hungry Paul
programme.desc: After a successful first date Leonard is head over heels for Shelley, though is unnerved when he hears she is due to go to the cinema with a man called Patrick. After obsessively questioning who Patrick might be, Leonard knows he must ask Shelley outright. Elsewhere, Hungry Paul has been shortlisted for the email sign-off phrase competition and attends the awards ceremony with his family. The outcome leads to a new opportunity for him with the National Mime Association. Comedy, narrated by Julia Roberts and starring Alex Lawther and Laurie Kynaston

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts, as celebrity guests Julian Clary and Sophy Ridge join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton. As usual, all concerned poke fun at the weeks headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by reality star and businesswoman Kim Kardashian and award-winning actress Sarah Paulson, who are appearing together in the new TV legal drama Alls Fair. Breaking Bad star Bryan Cranston chats about taking to the West End stage in All My Sons, while actress and singer Rachel Zegler also appears, fresh from wowing audiences at the London Palladium in Evita. Plus, Little Simz performs Lion, from her album Lotus

programme.title: How Are You? Its Alan (Partridge)
programme.desc: Alone in the Peaks with only a stick-cam, the radio presenter-turned-documentary-maker contemplates whether nature can heal a troubled mind, unlocking a heroic side some people doubted he ever had. Steve Coogan stars

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Reality competition in which contestants fight to be crowned the next superstar drag queen continues with the queens taking to the high seas for a cruise-themed talent show. Derry Girl Jamie-Lee ODonnell joins RuPaul, Michelle Visage and Alan Carr on the judging panel

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: History is filled with tales of great minds coming together, and collaborating, to achieve incredible things. Its also full of idiots working together to create an unholy mess and people forming partnerships for decidedly sinister reasons

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Music-loving friends Oli and Louise from Cardiff, father and daughter Peter and Carol-Ann from Derry and cousins Andrea and Gillian from Northampton compete in the music-based game show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Hosted by Marvin and Rochelle Humes

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts this game show in which three teams of contestants have to identify a board full of images, with a chance of winning up to £10,000 if they know them all. Taking part in this episode are mother-daughter duo Erin and Emma from Falkirk, friends Lil and Nick from Kent, and newly-married couple Ryan and Kin from Leicester.

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Reality competition in which contestants fight to be crowned the next superstar drag queen continues with the queens taking to the high seas for a cruise-themed talent show. Derry Girl Jamie-Lee ODonnell joins RuPaul, Michelle Visage and Alan Carr on the judging panel

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An FBI agent infiltrates a Californian surfing gang suspected of carrying out a series of armed robberies wearing masks modelled on former US presidents. However, his loyalties are tested to the limits when he is befriended by the gangs leader. Kathryn Bigelows thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Patrick Swayze, Gary Busey and Lori Petty

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Joe meets young dads who are navigating the highs and lows of fatherhood, looking back on his own experiences as a parent and sparking wider conversations about masculinity, the importance of positive male role models, and why its time for young dads to be seen, heard, supported - and celebrated. Reflecting on how becoming a father in his mid-twenties changed his life, he meets four young dads who, like he once did, are navigating the challenges of parenting and are determined to challenge stigma, overcome hardship and redefine what fatherhood looks like today

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an episode originally shown in 2011, Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of 2010 Winter Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Zen Motoring
programme.desc: Former battle rapper Ogmios gives his guide to being a zen driver, mystical roundabouts, light creepers and Scooter boys

Its also time to find out why they are an important keystone species. This episodes Teeny Tiny Task is to help the beach and the creatures by litter picking

programme.title: Whats On Your Head?
programme.desc: Rajvatan, who is a Sikh, tells us all about his terrific turban and what it means for him to wear it.

programme.title: Time for School
programme.desc: As the children arrive, there is a rainbow over the school. Mrs Farrell points it out to Bryn before they head inside to create their own rainbow on the carpet

programme.title: Graces Amazing Machines
programme.desc: Motorbike rider Grace shows off three machines that all move because of propellers. She flies a seaplane, shows off unusual hydrocopter and goes for a fast ride in a raceboat

programme.title: Yakka Dee!
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say pizza, and we go on a whirlwind word adventure! We see lots of pizza - a round pizza, a tomato pizza, a party pizza and a cheesy pizza! Theres also a banana pizza, and Dee plays a game of ping pong with a pizza! The journey is repeated with some special surprises along the way, and everyone has a boogie when Dees friend finally succeeds in saying todays word!

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Seven shows the others how to be lucky: ask a number friend to jump on your head!

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: The discovery of some invisible ink leads to all manner of tricks being played on the Alphablocks

programme.title: Wonderblocks

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Sing along with Orange as she helps Indigo and Violet to colour a rainbow.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels have a dance-off with Chippo and the Rock Slippy Crew

programme.title: Yukee

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friend play pizza restaurants, and Mr Tumble knits a jumper

programme.title: Teletubbies

programme.sub-title: Andy and the Naked Mole Rat
programme.desc: Andy Day jets off to Africas Sahara Desert in search of a naked mole rat. His mission takes him into its underground burrow

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: When Jess takes Evie for her first school visit, Waffle goes along too - on the condition that he doesnt sing. He tries his best to behave, but its hard for a Wonder Dog!

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Alice organises a relaxation class, and Molly helps get people to attend. However, just as everyone starts to relax, Bob and Moira start on some very noisy work

programme.title: The Game Catchers
programme.desc: The Game Catchers are lighter than air on a planet where they find acorn aliens

programme.title: Octonauts

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale of the One That Got Away
programme.desc: Peter and his friends encounter the legendary Jack Sharp trout that his father failed to catch, and try to reel the famous fish in for once and for all

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels help Duggee try out his new outdoor pizza oven. Duggee makes the bases then the Squirrels put on all the toppings they like - some of which prove to be interesting

programme.title: Vida the Vet
programme.desc: Its Healthy Fur Day, and all the animals in Sweetwood are coming to Vidas clinic to get groomed - except Zigzag, a bunny with some serious knots in her fluffy tail

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato tells his side of the story. Yes, he did freeze everyone, but with Carrots help he realises that Evil Pea had tricked him, and he vows to make it right

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizard isnt happy in his skin! Cosima tries everything to stop him scratching until she realises thats exactly what he needs to do. Hes shedding his skin!

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Bo is tired and falls asleep in the middle of hunting for Fabio’s lost inflatable fruit. It’s up to Mojo to finish the job - without waking up poor, exhausted Bo!

programme.title: Bluey

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad and his mates hit the backyard ready to rip up some tree stumps!

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug feels unappreciated at work and aims to get a pay rise by claiming a major courier service wants to hire him - but he ends up getting sacked. Meanwhile, Carries enthusiasm for tanning lotion proves disastrous. With Lou Ferrigno, star of cult TV series The Incredible Hulk

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray is delighted to be awarded an honorary doctorate, but hurts Debras feelings by thanking everyone except her in his acceptance speech. He claims it was an accident, though she takes the opportunity to remind him of past snubs that were obviously deliberate

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Amys parents draw attention to Roberts strange eating habits, making him feel self-conscious every time he sits down for a meal - so Debra devises a plan to cure him once and for all. Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Brad Garrett star

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: An invitation to spend Easter with the Barones spurs the MacDougalls to unite with the family over a 500-piece jigsaw puzzle - until Ray and Pat upset the apple cart by indulging in more than their fair share of bonding. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Colorado, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz try to negotiate with a collector who demands a high price for every item up for sale. Plus, a lone mountain home features its own jailhouse, an underground bomb shelter and an awesome collection of Western ware

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Italy, two Manchester foodies prepare a vegan banquet. In Greece, a London couple look to kick-start their food tours business. Meanwhile in Spain, there are more surprises for two Lincolnshire hoteliers, and a Yorkshire entrepreneur faces some life-changing decisions

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: The team heads to Sues house in Tiverton, Devon, finding a moped that brings back memories, and fighting over a petrol gauge that Simon OBrien wants to upcycle into a clock

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the long-running words-and-numbers game with Les Dennis joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Leah Charles-King heads to Spains Mar Menor to help Eileen from Birmingham find the perfect holiday home, where she can take time out from her demanding job. To also assist her with the search, Eileens brings along her daughter Khaya, who plans to visit regularly. Eileen ideally wants a two-bedroom apartment near the beach, and has a maximum budget of £43,500

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: After a crisis of confidence, Paul and Yip visit Italy to see other village projects, including Robertos record-breaking bridge. Meanwhile, Justin and Mel discover a First World War document hidden in the beams in their French village. Over in Spain, Ben and Susanas plans to convert a barn into more guest accommodation run into trouble

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The weeks final visit is to Marc and Matts gastropub in Kent, The Dog at Wingham. The pair have raised the BandBers expectations throughout the week, and at first glance it seems they were right to do so. However, one visitor thinks theyve got a ruff deal with their room. The Dog is renowned for its food, so its hoped a perfect breakfast will put Marc and Matt onto a winner

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fourth to host in Cardiff is IT consultant and part-time party boy David, who offers his guests a fully vegan dining experience. It remains to be seen whether his efforts will sate the appetites of the die-hard omnivores. However, he definitely brings the party - in the form of a living room micro-rave

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sisters Ros and Elizabeth want to retire together to their dream home near Bergerac in France. The Dordogne is famous for its wine, warm summers, castles and green forests. Plus, on the banks of the river, Bergeracs old town offers charming cafes and shops for locals and tourists alike. Lee Juggurnauth shows Ros and Elizabeth five options for their maximum budget of £350,000, from a grand country home and picture-perfection to a place ticking boxes by the minute

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: George Clarkes Homes in the Wild
programme.desc: Just a stones throw from New Zealands Auckland City, George sets sail for Kawau Island - a boatlovers paradise where life is lived by the tides. With no roads and with complicated access, he explores a community that embraces true off-grid living. He pops in on an old friend to visit an architecturally designed boathouse with the waves lapping at its front door, and visits a stunning home crafted around a lifelong love of timber. He also discovers a one-of-a-kind yurt - a circular sanctuary full of character and creativity perched on craggy cliffs

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The contestants are pushed to their limits as they try to pull off a heist, pay dubious homage to their heroes and shout about foodstuffs while wielding a mallet. Phil Ellis does a spot of rewiring, Ania Magliano spews some blue jelly, Sanjeev Bhaskar asks for a comfort break and Maisie Adam squawks like an exotic bird

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off

As always, Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith taste their efforts - but who will make it through to next weeks semi-final?

programme.title: Ramsays Hotel Hell
programme.desc: In Oregon, Gordon Ramsay tries to rescue the Applegate River Lodge, which is around $1million in debt. The chef questions whether owner Richard Daviss interest in smoking cannabis is distracting him from the problems at this family-built inn, and encounters Richards sons Duke and Dusty, whose fiery relationship seems to prevent them from working together to tackle the establishments financial troubles

programme.title: Car S.O.S.

The car belongs to 37-year-old Ashley, who even went as far as changing his surname to match his car. Sadly, when Ashley fell ill, his car ended up rotting away under a cover

When she discovers it wasnt an accident, Stephanie turns to a former CIA operative who can help her find the culprits. But her quest to uncover the truth soon turns into a full-blown quest for revenge as she decides to punish those responsible. Drama, starring Blake Lively, Jude Law and Matilda Ziegler

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA

Just when it looks like he has turned the corner and is ready to accept help, Joe slips back into his old ways, denying his own failings and picking petty fights. Can Gordon get this stubborn owner to finally accept his advice and secure the future of his restaurant?

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Yannis in Seattle, where he clashes with defiant owner Peter Avgoustiou, a chef so set in his ways that he hasnt allowed any changes to his menu since the Greek restaurant opened in 1984. Peters family is concerned the business is becoming trapped in the past, and standards are slipping, but he seems determined to stick to his guns

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Below Deck: Mediterranean

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Guernsey and Alderney compete for the £1,000 cash prize. Sophie and Turk begin the competition with a locally sourced menu, but dessert proves to be their downfall. programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride

Among the employees he meets are a woman who has worked for the company for eight years without a pay rise, and another who was attacked with pepper spray while trying to stop a robbery

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge starts a carpentry business, but quickly learns she will need more than mere practical skill if her venture is to succeed. programme.title: The Simpsons

Unfamiliar with scouring the horizon, they could do with a tip from security officer Rich who, after four decades at sea, has a database filled with thousands of ship sightings

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When a curmudgeonly resident with few fans in the community passes away, the Butlers step up to host a memorial, leading Calvin to discover an unexpected revelation about himself

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave is thrilled when Calvin invites him golfing, confident that it represents progress in their relationship, but Calvin may have an ulterior motive

programme.title: Modern Family

In Europe, a Dutch family brave some unseasonal pouring rain on a Tuk Tuk tour around Porto

programme.title: Oblivion
programme.desc: A repairman is assigned to salvage the remaining resources from Earth, which has been left a devastated wasteland after a war with an alien race. He discovers a human survivor on the surface of the planet, an encounter that exposes secrets from the past that threaten the future of the human race. Sci-fi adventure, starring Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.sub-title: Best Naughty Bits: Naked, Crazy, Stupid Love
programme.desc: A romp through the Naked Attraction archive to catch up with dates that led to full-on romances - as well as some that turned out to be a disaster. They include Wolverhampton DJ Darryl from series one, who found his partner in Maria, and Scottish bombshell Amira from series five, who gives the lowdown on what really happened between her and Ste after their night of passion

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.sub-title: Naked Attraction: All Out and Proud
programme.desc: Anna Richardson hosts a Pride special, celebrating all of the most memorable singletons from across the sexual spectrum. Plus, a chance to catch up with some of the unforgettable pickers, including 75-year-old bisexual Ian - the shows oldest ever picker, Raheem the professional dancer looking to pop his gay cherry, and transfeminine singleton Callie, who came on the show to find her first proper date

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including After Life, This Morning, Coronation Street, Britains Got Talent, Jamie: Keep Cooking and Carry On, and BBC news coverage of President Trumps comments on China. From May 2020

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht
programme.desc: After the guests complain about the service, Daisy is confronted by two crew members. The glitz and glam arrive as a drag queen duo and their witty friends sashay onto the boat

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Mook, the Chef, the Wife and Her Homer
programme.desc: Homer volunteers to take Fat Tonys place as the head of the local Mafia, dragging the rest of the Simpson family into Springfields criminal underworld. With the guest voices of metal band Metallica and Sopranos stars Joe Pantoliano and Michael Imperioli

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Four Great Women and a Manicure
programme.desc: Marge takes Lisa for her first manicure at the salon, where they debate whether a woman can be smart, beautiful and powerful all at the same time. Four tales featuring strong women from history and literature are retold with Selma appearing as Elizabeth I, Lisa as Snow White, Marge as Lady Macbeth and Maggie as Howard Roark from The Fountainhead

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire is determined to make up for her less-than-joyful mood at Jay and Glorias wedding by throwing their 10th anniversary party, at which Phil plans to perform a magic trick

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay makes a Thanksgiving toast to everyones recent success. But it turns out that some havent told the truth about their triumphs

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist and explorer leads a team on a mission to summit a remote and unclimbed mountain in the Stauning Alps of Greenland, crossing a vast river and skiing across a glacier

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve leads a cave-diving team into the largest unexplored cave network on Earth. Below the jungles of Mexico, they push further and deeper than anyone has gone before

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve Backshall ventures into more uncharted territory in pursuit of new discoveries and world firsts. He begins by joining a team of world-class kayakers to head to Kamchatka to take on white-water in a bid to explore a wilderness packed with more brown bears than anywhere else

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve joins forces with ropes expert Aldo Kane and Saudi Arabian geologists Mahmoud Al-Shanti and Hala Alwagdani to search for the longest lava tube in Arabia

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Reno, Nevada to Californias Napa County, taking to the skies over the Sierra Nevada mountain range and trying his hand at cowboy dressage

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Martella and Stamp take an American woman who has been caught shoplifting into custody. Meanwhile, Roach is having money troubles

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Operation Arctic
programme.desc: The team presents more news from the remote Canadian town of Churchill on the edge of the Arctic. Kate Humble meets the Inuit artists inspired by the changing world around them, and Gordon Buchanan finds out how the townsfolk deal with the more troublesome bears when he follows the eviction of a repeat offender. Plus, a live report from the tundra on how the bears are getting on

programme.title: Operation Arctic
programme.desc: Gordon Buchanan visits Churchill, Manitoba, a Canadian town where humans live in close proximity to polar bears. For two months of every year, the animals gather in the area, waiting for sea ice to form so they can head north for their winter hunt. Gordon meets local police officers and refuse collectors who have to work in close proximity to the bears and meets a woman who was mauled on the towns main street

programme.title: Incredible Journeys with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon presents highlights of his journeys around the world, and catches up with the people he met, including a Burmese undercover human rights campaigner, a homeless woman living in a Hollywood railway bridge, and a 10 year-old boy he met working in terrible conditions in a glass factory in Bangladesh

programme.title: Incredible Journeys with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon recalls some of the most dangerous experiences of his travels, from coming under fire in war-torn Mogadishu to squaring off with a female wrestler in Mexico City. Among the past destinations featured are a police cell in the far east of Russia, and the programme also looks back at his encounters with ambulance crews in San Salvador and anti-smuggling police in Italy

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos journey through California takes him to San Francisco, where he travels through the citys streets by cable car, before heading across the bay to Sausalito

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wealthy and ambitious cattleman plans to seize all the land surrounding his own. A peaceful rancher living nearby ignores warnings to sell up and avoid a conflict, and as he suffers a campaign of intimidation, he is forced to adopt violent methods to defend his livelihood. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Alexander Knox, Joan Leslie and Ellen Drew

programme.title: San Demetrio London
programme.desc: A group of lowly British Merchant Navy sailors save the San Demetrio oil tanker after it was almost destroyed by the enemy, They brave fire and ocean to sail the the vessel 900 miles to the safety of a Scottish port. Drama, starring Walter Fitzgerald, Mervyn Johns and Gordon Jackson

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: After being framed for murder and narrowly escaping the town mob, Jim Guthrie returns three years later to find the real killer. Western, starring Dana Andrews and Dianne Foster

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain
programme.desc: Thanks to his race car driver owner, golden retriever Enzo learns that the techniques needed on the racetrack can also be used to successfully navigate the journey of life. Comedy drama, starring Milo Ventimiglia and Amanda Seyfried

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: As the space race reaches fever pitch in the early 1960s, a trio of female African-American mathematicians attempt to overcome prejudice and find work with NASA. Their remarkable skills prove vital in getting an astronaut into orbit and bringing him safely back to Earth, but to realise their potential they must overcome deep-seated prejudice in the space programme and society as a whole. Fact-based drama, starring Taraji P Henson, Octavia Spencer, Janelle Monae and Kevin Costner

programme.title: Bloodshot
programme.desc: Marine Ray Garrison is shot dead during a mission but regains consciousness in Kuala Lumpur in the care of Dr Emil Harting. The medic brought Ray back to life using nanotechnology, augmenting the Marines strength, agility, speed and healing capabilities on the battlefield. Rechristened Bloodshot, Garrison wages top-secret war alongside other enhanced killing machines, while piecing together a conspiracy that robbed him of the woman he loved. Sci-fi thriller, starring Vin Diesel, Eiza Gonzalez and Guy Pearce

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: While exploring space for new worlds, a probe belonging to the Life Foundation discovers a comet covered in symbiotic lifeforms. Following the probes return to Earth, journalist Eddie Brock investigates sinister trials being carried out by the corporation, and after being infected by an alien symbiote, develops superhuman strength and power. Fantasy adventure, starring Tom Hardy and Riz Ahmed

programme.title: Saint Maud
programme.desc: A nurse finds herself at a crossroads in both her personal life and career when a patient in her care dies after her attempts to give them CPR fail. She decides to make some wholesale changes, including becoming a devout Roman Catholic and even going so far as to change her name. She finds a job caring for a terminally ill atheist woman and resolves that her new mission in life is to not only provide palliative care her, but to also save her charges godless soul from an eternity with Satan. Horror, starring Morfydd Clark and Jennifer Ehle

programme.title: Carrington VC
programme.desc: A decorated Army major resorts to embezzling mess funds to make ends meet - an act that leaves him facing a court martial, with the evidence stacked against him. To make matters worse, his wife sees the opportunity to get revenge for his wartime affairs by providing false testimony for the prosecution. Courtroom drama, starring David Niven, Margaret Leighton, Noelle Middleton, Laurence Naismith and Clive Morton

programme.title: The Enemy Below
programme.desc: The captain of an American destroyer in the South Atlantic is still recovering from the sinking of his previous vessel. He tries to outwit a cunning German U-boat commander, but comes to respect the courage of his enemy. However, his crew fears he is not up to the challenge of defeating his opponent. Second World War thriller, starring Robert Mitchum, Curt Jurgens, Theodore Bikel and David Hedison

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: A homesteader and his son fall foul of a crooked gambler, who makes off with the farmers horse and rifle and leaves behind his abandoned girlfriend. However, the three of them are forced to flee by river on a raft when their farm comes under attack. Western, starring Robert Mitchum, Marilyn Monroe and Rory Calhoun

programme.title: Bridge of Spies Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about the making of the Cold War espionage drama

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: A workaholic father tries to make up for his perpetual absence from home by promising to buy his son a hugely popular action figure for Christmas - little realising every other father in town has the same idea. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sinbad, Jake Lloyd, Rita Wilson, Robert Conrad and Phil Hartman

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: A romantic novelist goes in search of her kidnapped sister in the steamy jungles of South America, only to become the target of a villainous general who demands as a ransom the valuable treasure map in her possession. Help is at hand in the form of a craggy daredevil fortune hunter, who has his eye on a share of the profits. Comedy adventure, starring Michael Douglas, Kathleen Turner and Danny DeVito

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen
programme.desc: Secret Service agent Mike Banning is framed for an assassination attempt on the President. Pursued by his own agency and the FBI, Banning races to clear his name and uncover the real terrorist threat - which has set its sights on Air Force One. Action thriller sequel, starring Gerard Butler and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: X.
programme.desc: Film producer Wayne bankrolls X-rated fantasy The Farmers Daughters featuring his fame-hungry girlfriend Maxine, burlesque dancer Bobby-Lynne and porn star Jackson Hole. The film-makers venture into the Texan countryside to shoot on location at a farm belonging to elderly couple Howard and Pearl. However, before long the cast are fighting for their lives. Seventies-set horror, starring Mia Goth, Brittany Snow and Jenna Ortega

programme.title: The Innocents
programme.desc: A highly strung vicars daughter takes up the post of governess to two orphaned children living with their servants in a sprawling Gothic mansion. She learns of the scandalous history of her predecessor and her lover, and suspects their spirits are the cause of her charges disquieting behaviour. Horror, based on Henry James short story The Turn of the Screw, starring Deborah Kerr, Michael Redgrave, Peter Wyngarde and Megs Jenkins

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: A US Army officer, once branded a coward after hesitating during a battle, is entrusted with transporting a group of supposed military heroes on a long and gruelling trek back to base in 1916 Mexico. However, the men soon reveal their true and less than heroic colours, leaving the disgraced soldier to show them who is boss. Adventure, starring Gary Cooper, Rita Hayworth, Van Heflin and Richard Conte

programme.title: Texas
programme.desc: Two American Civil War veterans travel home to the South, where one becomes a rustler and the other takes a job on a ranch. After going their separate ways, the former friends are drawn into a confrontation when one tries to steal the cattle that the other is driving across the state. The situation is inflamed further when it becomes apparent that both men are in love with the same woman. Western, starring William Holden, Glenn Ford, Claire Trevor and George Bancroft

programme.desc: A mysterious signal is transmitted to every mobile phone in the world, causing those who hear it to turn into bloodthirsty maniacs. A writer who was unaffected by the transmission bands together with a few other survivors to track down his family and unlock the mystery behind the crisis. Sci-fi thriller based on Stephen Kings novel, starring John Cusack and Samuel L Jackson

programme.desc: Sam decides to have a housewarming party - but things quickly get out of control. Marlon accidentally shares his frustrations about his marriage with the regulars of the Woolpack.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Leanne feels guilty when she learns Roger has invested all his savings in the restaurant, while Ashley invites Casey for a drink. Joanne threatens Carla and Liam with a tribunal.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Vernon prepares to jet off to Spain - so Liz makes a heartfelt plea for him to take her with him. Leanne turns to Carla for help again and Jason is unhappy to see Eileen with Pat.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa and Martin search for a nursery now that Janice has left, and Mrs Tishell is shocked to find out that Al has very high blood pressure. Louisa also helps with the diagnosis of a pupil, which spurs her on to explore the possibilities of a change of career. This is not welcome news for Martin, who dislikes any kind of change, even if it could be for the better. Elsewhere, Ruth is approached about selling her farm. Starring Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz, Selina Cadell and Ian McNeice

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A mix-up over the job offer results in two new doctors arriving at the hospital to take up the position. Meanwhile, Catherine makes her feelings clear to Carnegie about their relationship and Stellas night out ends badly. Hospital drama, starring Robert Cavanah

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A spate of petty thefts is traced to a local nursing home, but Blaketons investigations uncover something far more sinister. Meanwhile, Davids first day in his new job goes spectacularly wrong, but Bernie is not surprised. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ashfordly Hall throws open its doors to the public, but all hell breaks loose when a collection of valuable Constable sketches is stolen. Mike and Tom are sent to question the chief suspect, an 80-year-old art thief, only to find him mugged and bound to a chair - with none of the paintings anywhere in sight. Nostalgic drama, starring Jason Durr and Ryan Early

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon apologises to Donna by cooking a romantic dinner - but its not long before the pair are arguing again. Sam sells his chickens in a bid to make it on his own.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jasmine follows Nicola to try and prove she is having an affair with David. Ross apologises to Marlon and Emily finds out about Laurels attempts at match-making.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Casey visits to help Ashley cope in Claires absence, Leanne doesnt get off to a good start with her new agency chef and Sean pressurises Violet into taking a pregnancy test.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Casey proves a big help to Ashley, so he invites her to stay for dinner. But then one thing leads to another. Leanne is annoyed when Paul criticises her food.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: There is excitement throughout the house and nearby village as the annual cricket match draws near, and the event brings out Roberts competitive side. Violets great-niece Rose arrives, but a trip to London reveals there is more to her than meets the eye, while Matthew and Mary seem to be keeping secrets from each other. Thomass future appears to be uncertain, but he may have found an unexpected ally in Bates

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The curmudgeonly GP is perturbed when he discovers Louisa, who is already spending much of her time away from home, has applied to take up a child and adolescent counselling course. However, achieving a work-life balance is far from the greatest of concerns for some of the Ellinghams neighbours, not least of whom is Al, whose plans to demonstrate his business acumen are placed in jeopardy when Ken decides to close the pub. Unless Ruth agrees to serve as a guarantor, Ken will not allow Morwenna and Al to take over the establishment, so the pair arrange a race-walking event to raise funds and prove the community is on their side

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A prodigal son returns to claim his inheritance, setting off alarm bells for Ventress, whose instinct is confirmed when a series of accidents at the carpet factory signals the managements scant regard for life and limb. Meanwhile, Vernon Scripps spies an opportunity to make merry as well as money by organising a beauty pageant, but reckons without the determined opposition of disapproving Joyce Jowett, who will stop at nothing to halt the event

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Hippies colonise Lawsons holiday cottages, causing much local dissent and tut-tutting. The only people who dont object to their presence are an undercover journalist in search of a scoop, and Vernon, who is not slow to spot a way of capitalising on the situation. Starring Geoffrey Hughes and Malcolm Tierney

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The dead body of a teenage boy is found in a reservoir near a remote rural timber community. Vera and her team investigate, and discover that the boy had already been missing for three days prior to his death. However, the case is complicated by an apparent conspiracy of silence, as many of the townsfolk refuse to cooperate with the police investigation. A complex web of relationships between the victims friends and family slowly emerges, with many dark secrets that could have driven someone to kill

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Chief Superintendent Jack Cornish goes missing and a recently embalmed body is discovered near an isolated farm track - could there be a link? As Hathaway goes on sabbatical in Kosovo, Lewis takes an awkward young constable under his wing to investigate the case. Guest starring Lucy Speed and Peter Davison, with Kevin Whately and Babou Ceesay

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: The suffocation of an elderly woman proves the prelude to a string of similar killings - and makes Tony wonder whether respected psychologist Jonathan Goode, one of his personal heroes, could be involved. As events unfold, it begins to seem increasingly likely that his idol not only has feet of clay, but may also be dangerously unbalanced

programme.desc: Nicola convinces David to agree to go along with her deception. Jamies plan to impress Louise and Terry backfires and Paddy voices his concerns about Rosemarys whereabouts.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ashley worries Casey might have told Claire about their kiss, Paul offers to become Leannes new chef and Violet worries that Jamie has discovered about her arrangement with Sean.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Violet tells Sean the happy news, Claire returns home to Ashley, and Paul makes his mark at the restaurant. John offers to help Sally with her studies.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: In the Christmas special from 2012, Robert and his family make their annual summer visit to his Scottish cousins at Duneagle Castle, leaving most of their servants at home. Edith discovers newspaper editor Michael Gregson is also on holiday in the area and may not be there just for the sketching and fishing, while personal servant OBrien finds a kindred spirit below stairs in the form of her opposite number. Meanwhile, at Downton, Carson faces the task of keeping the staff focused on their work polishing the silverware and cleaning, but with the Granthams hundreds of miles away, minds begin to wander to other things, including the forthcoming Thirsk Country Fair

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Christmas is just around the corner, but the last thing Aidensfields residents feel like doing is over-indulging as a salmonella epidemic grips the village and Dr Summerbee struggles to maintain her goodwill. Meanwhile, Vernon decides the time is right to expand Bernies funeral empire

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Christmas arrives in Aidensfield, and Mike and Tricia try to reunite a blind woman with her stolen guide dog. Elsewhere, a young woman at the centre of a political scandal seeks refuge in Aidensfield as she attempts to avoid the paparazzi. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bullard asks Barnaby to investigate the disappearance of a friends daughter who was a member of the Oblong Foundation, a cult based at Malham Hall. Jones goes under cover as a new recruit to solve the mystery, but he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion, which could be linked to the missing woman. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Will Knightley, Kevin Doyle, Holly Aird, Barbara Flynn and John Woodvine

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. After seven years of ducking the issue, Lewis and Hobson are embarking on a relationship, but the detective also has a new case to solve. Elderly don Richard Seager is murdered on the night of his release from prison, having served a sentence for causing death by dangerous driving. Crushed by a classic car, Seager mysteriously scratched the number 500 into its paintwork before his demise, and the academics wife suspects a member of his victims family is responsible for the killing. With Stephen Churchett, Alison Steadman and Edward Fox

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: One-off feature-length thriller, in which clinical psychologist Tony Hill (Robson Green) leaves behind the familiar streets of Bradfield and visits America to appear as an expert witness in the trial of an Iraq combat veteran accused of multiple murder. Sweltering heat and venomous snakes are among the difficulties he faces while struggling with the complexities of the US legal system. With Brad Hawkins and Naima Imani Lett

programme.desc: Jacqui Oatley is joined by Alan Warriner-Little and Chris Mason to present coverage of day one from Westfalenhallen in Dortmund, Germany, featuring eight first-round matches played over the best of 11 legs. Ritchie Edhouse was the surprise winner of the 2024 event but is unable to defend his title after failing to qualify this time around, while Michael van Gerwen, who has won this tournament four times, looks back to his best at the 2025 World Series of Darts Finals and is expected to challenge for the title. Commentary comes from Stuart Pyke, John Rawling, and Ned Boulting

programme.desc: Jacqui Oatley is joined by Alan Warriner-Little and Chris Mason to present coverage of day two from Westfalenhallen in Dortmund, Germany, featuring eight first-round matches played over the best of 11 legs. Luke Humphries was in fine form at this stage 12 months ago, recording a 6-2 victory over Nathan Aspinall, while Luke Littler suffered a shock 6-4 defeat to Andrew Gilding. Elsewhere, eventual tunner-up Jermaine Wattimena produced a stunning 6-0 whitewash of the number 10 seed Peter Wright, and his fellow Dutchman Danny Noppert triumphed 6-2 over Joe Cullen. Commentary comes from Stuart Pyke, John Rawling, and Ned Boulting

programme.title: Bloody Tales of the Tower
programme.desc: Historian Suzannah Lipscomb and journalist Joe Crowley investigate stories connected to the Tower of London, looking at the contrasting fates of three people imprisoned in the Tower of London for treason. They examine what happened to Jesuit priest Fr John Gerard after he was accused of being sent by the pope to overthrow Elizabeth I, and look at the cases of Gunpowder Plot conspirator Guy Fawkes and German spy Josef Jakobs, who was captured in 1941 after breaking his ankle while parachuting into England on a mission

programme.title: Bloody Tales of the Tower
programme.desc: Tudor historian Suzannah Lipscomb and journalist Joe Crowley investigate the history of the Tower of London, examining stories that challenge accepted beliefs about the infamous prison using original historical sources and dramatic reconstructions. Here they consider why it took executioner John Ketch five blows to decapitate the Duke of Monmouth in July 1685, and examine whether former inmate Lady Jane Grey had a legitimate claim to the English throne. They also look into how a ragtag gang managed to breach its defences during the Peasants Revolt in June 1381 and killed Simon of Sudbury, the Archbishop of Canterbury

programme.title: Bloody Tales of the Tower
programme.desc: Suzannah Lipscomb and Joe Crowley examine the evidence and report on the intrigues that led to three royal deaths, detailing the sometimes salacious accusations levelled at Anne Boleyn, Catherine Howard and Lady Arabella Seymour. Henry VIIIs chief minister Thomas Cromwell informed the monarch of gossip about Anne and court musician Mark Smeaton, but allegations at her public trial included adultery with five men, incest with her brother George and treason. Rumours of relationships with distant cousin Francis Dereham and Thomas Culpeper led to Catherine Howards execution, while Lady Arabella, a serious threat to the ruling Stuart dynasty, is thought to have committed suicide against a backdrop of a cross-dressing noblewoman and two escapes from the Tower

programme.title: Air Crash Investigation
programme.desc: In June 1982, the engines of British Airways Flight 009 failed after it flew through volcanic ash caused by an eruption and the plane began falling from the sky. Minutes before it would have crashed into the sea the engines roared back to life - narrowly avoiding a catastrophe. The investigation looks at the lessons learned from the incident, which changed the way pilots were trained

Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and his team of experts restore Maggies fathers guitar that has seen many a journey travelling with him on the river tugboats in Guyana. Maggies father passed when she was a teenager and the family moved to the UK bringing his guitar with them, now shes hoping the repair shop can bring it back to life for her musical grandchildren. Malcolm from the West Midlands bring the team an old fishing reel that once belonged to his grandad Wilf. Expert Steve Fletcher has a turn at fixing up the jammed-up reel so Malcolm can return to the water. Suzie Fletcher is tasked with fixing up Catherines pig-shaped footstool named Pogo. Originally given as an engagement gift from her grandfather to her grandmother over 70 years ago, the stool has had pride of place in the living rooms of three generations of her family

programme.title: The Repair Shop

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a luxury fabric manufacturer in Suffolk, Drew Pritchard is impressed by historic silks once used in the royal household. Plus, in Scotland, he haggles with a young baron

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a Catholic church in Liverpool, Drew Pritchards prayers are answered with a pair of very rare chairs. In Leicestershire, he finds industrial gems in the worlds largest bell foundry

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard haggles hard at a museum of vintage farm equipment in Exmouth. Later, he is bowled over by an amazing collection of arts and crafts furniture

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps buyers who want to relocate from Surrey to north Devon on a £650,000 budget, and visits the annual regatta in the fishing village of Appledore

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple from Bedfordshire who are looking for a character property in Norfolk with a good-sized garden for some new canine companions, all on their budget of £450,000. Ginny also heads to Great Yarmouth, where she straps in for a white-knuckle ride on one of the countrys last remaining wooden rollercoasters

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and John Tee visit a 500-year-old copper mine in the village of Coniston, Cumbria. They uncover a slipware dairy bowl, pattern wheels and a retail counter

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore heads to Scotlands east coast on the lookout for quality discards at Wallyford Recycling Centre. Theres an unwanted armchair to be rescued with the help of upcycler Sarah Peterson, a retro chest of drawers gets some loving attention from sign-writer Joel Poole and Sarah herself stops a collection of coffee jars from smashing in the skips

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: James Braxton and Izzie Balmer hunt for profit-making antiques in Snowdonia. Scent bottles, brick moulds, and cloisonne bowls attract the attention of these antiques aficionados. James finds time to slip into chainmail to learn about a revolutionary Welsh King, while Izzie befriends an equally iconic and beefy local legend. The duo then head to the latest auction in Leicestershire

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: James Braxton and Izzie Balmer hunt for profit-making antiques in south Wales. Jewellery specialist Izzie strikes gold while shopping, finding a bangle, pendant and earrings, and takes a punt on a Wedgwood pie dish. She also dips into the history of Tenby, a seaside town once a Georgian spa resort. Meanwhile, James accumulates a hoard of shiny items and one piece of silver causes a shock at auction. Later, the pair watch on from the impressive Cilwendeg Mansion in Pembrokeshire as the final auction of the trip takes place in Buckinghamshire

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: Angus Ashworth helps two NHS workers sell 30 years worth of collectables in Oxford. Later, he discovers over 200 crane replicas

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: Angus Ashworth takes a trip back in time when he visits a home that is dressed like a Victorian townhouse. Later, he helps a mother and daughter with an emotional task

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Paul Martin and Margie Cooper motor through Cornwall, picking up an antique milking stool and a very loud 1920s car horn. In a break from shopping Paul learns about the formation of the light infantry and the brave actions of one soldier turned pacifist while Margie tries a tea grown entirely in Britain

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Paul Martin head for Plymouth on the final leg of their journey. Along the way Margie hears the story of a footballer, once forgotten, finally being given the recognition he deserves. Paul is all at sea discovering the tale of a lighthouse, built in the 18th century, that became a beacon of engineering prowess

programme.title: Yorkshire Air 999
programme.desc: The team fly to a critically ill motorcyclist who has crashed into a wall. In Thirsk, a DIY enthusiast is trapped beneath a collapsed outbuilding

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: In East Yorkshire, the team tend to a motorcyclist trapped under the wheels of a car, while in the Dales, medics treat a holidaymaker who has been trampled by cows

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Newfoundland Sylvie is a big therapy dog with big soft cuddles who loves to help people when theyre worried. She and her owner Katrina visit all sorts of people every day, young and old. Sylvie and her owner Katrina are helping a girl called Akilah, who is joining the local school after arriving from a foreign country. Lots of things will be very different for her, so Sylvie will need her super heart to make her feel as welcome as possible. After meeting Akilah and her mum, along with Fred the teaching assistant, Sylvie takes her to the school hall for some lunch, stopping to admire some artwork along the way. Then Sylvie acts as Akilahs furry tour guide on a whistlestop tour of the school, including a trip to the library, before guiding her to her new classroom to meet the teacher and all her new friends. There will be lots of new faces, and everyone will be talking in a language shes still learning - but with Sylvie and her super heart by her side, Akilah is sure to make lots of friends.

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Tinks is a disability assistance dog for her owner Charli, who has a condition that makes it painful for her to pick things up or to push and pull things. Tinks uses her super fetch skills to help Charli every day. The smallest of the Dog Squad gang, Tinks is a little Lhasa apso with lots of big dog energy. Charli is meeting her friend Annabel for lunch at the local cafe. They havent been out for a lunch treat for ages, and the cafes speciality is Tinkss favourite - chicken. First, Charli parks her car using her blue parking badge and then gets her wheelchair out of the boot using a hoist. Tinks then helps Charli go into the cafe, find a table and go to the counter to order their lunch. But when the cafe owner sees Tinks, he tells Charli that they only allow in guide dogs and that Tinks will have to wait outside. Brave Tinks summons all her big dog energy to help Charli persuade the owner to let them stay and enjoy their chicken sandwich.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to Cornwall to see former skydivers Leigh and Richards progress on the transformation of a derelict 17th century flour mill into a four storey, three-bedroom home. The pair fell in love with the building back in 2017 and put their lives on hold to move 250 miles to live in a caravan on site while they renovated the building, giving themselves just 12 months and a £250,000 budget. Once work began the true scale of the damage to the building was revealed and the couple were forced to pay out unexpected bills and take on a lot of the work load themselves. When the pandemic hit, the mission to finish the mill became an all-consuming affair but by January 2021 they still werent finished

Ireland finished second to Slovenia in Group B2 by virtue of an inferior goal difference, having matched their record of five wins and one loss, while Belgium finished third in Group A3 after winning two and losing four of their six matches

programme.title: The Last Duel

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Ned finally takes up his role at the side of the king, but struggles to deal with the political power games of Roberts cunning advisers. The weary lord is asked to organise a tournament, but finds the royal finances in a dire state - and his job is made even harder by troubling news from home. Meanwhile, Tyrions visit to the Wall reveals the men of the Nights Watch are in desperate need of reinforcement, and relations between Daenerys and Viserys become increasingly strained. Fantasy drama, starring Sean Bean and Mark Addy

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Liverpool, cutting through cliches about football and the Beatles to explore its less-celebrated treasures. Among his destinations are a 1930s banking building that has remained unaltered since closing in 2007, a well-appointed set of toilets and a recording studio hidden in a bar. He also discovers which former dictator once spent Christmas in the city

programme.title: Red Right Hand
programme.desc: Cash is attempting to live an honest and quiet life, but when Big Cat forces him back into her services, he proves capable of anything to protect the town and the only family he has left. Thriller, starring Orlando Bloom and Andie MacDowell
