programme.sub-title: Preston North End v Sheffield United 24.10
programme.desc: Preston North End v Sheffield United (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the Championship match from Deepdale, as the two teams at either ends of the table go head to head. The hosts are pushing for a place in the top two currently after a positive start to the season that saw them lose just one of their first nine games. The visitors, however, are languishing near the bottom end of the table after a horrendous start to the season that saw them replace Ruben Selles with former manager Chris Wilder after just five league games

programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: India v New Zealand. Coverage of the group match from Dr. DY Patil Sports Academy, Navi Mumbai. The Kiwis won their one and only World Cup in South Africa in 2000 when they beat Australia by four runs. India have reached two finals at this tournament but lost on both occasions in 2005 and 2017

programme.desc: Sri Lanka v Pakistan. Coverage of the group match from R.Premadasa Stadium, Colombo. programme.title: Gadget Man
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade tests a range of products designed to make DIY home decorating and domestic maintenance stress-free activities. He makes use of robot lawnmowers, the worlds safest saw, an automatic wallpapering machine and the latest generation of 3D printers that take just seconds to produce plates and cutlery, before setting himself the challenge of giving a room a makeover without lifting a finger

programme.title: Gadget Man
programme.desc: In an edition focusing on the worlds smallest gadgets, Richard Ayoade visits musician Alex James at his farm to demonstrate how to swap large appliances for tiny alternatives, and creates a compact house of five interchangeable rooms, before inviting comedian Jimmy Carr for a tour. He also shows Michelin-starred chef Galton Blackiston a device that can prepare a three-course meal entirely on its own

programme.title: Special Ops: To Catch a Criminal
programme.desc: A nationwide investigation begins when Dorset police uncover an international gang posing as couriers to scam vulnerable pensioners out of thousands of pounds

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Britains most talented detectives uncover human trafficking in Bristol, hunt the leader of a county lines gang in Surrey, and trawl through hours of CCTV to stop a vaccine fraudster in London

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: A legendary diesel locomotive, thats undergone over half a million pounds worth of repairs must be hauled over 40 miles ready for a diesel gala

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The Train Truckers are on the clock this week as they attempt to move a 100-ton diesel engine to a gala extravaganza, as well as a 175-ton rail crane destined for Egypt

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Leamington Spa, and the up-market town brings out the businessman in Heavy D who gets more than he bargained for in one auction

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Things escalate between Nat and Boudicca and there are explosive consequences when Scotty fails to read a warning sign

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: As well as Heavy D, Nat has to deal with some voodoo magic, which all proves too much for her. Thankfully auctioneer Sean Kelly is on hand with an emergency vehicle

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Barry, Darren and Scotty get up front and personal, while Boudicca and Linda go nose to nose over an uplifting prize. Meanwhile, John gives Nat a hard time for blind bidding

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Team Salvage try to recover two 16-tonne sections of a bridge washed away by floods, and Team Edge Recovery go off-road to rescue a driver stranded in a national park

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Jaguar XJ and races against the rotation of the Earth. James May travels to America to drive a Nasa Space Exploration Vehicle and Richard Hammond tests two of the most famous supercars of the 1980s - the Porsche 959 and the Ferrari F40. John Prescott is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an episode originally shown in 2011, Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of 2010 Winter Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Asian Adventure
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King conclude their culinary journey around Asia in South Korea, a country whose food is set to be the next big thing in the UK. On a night out with young people in the capital Seoul, they sample the Korean take on barbecued food and fried chicken, then head south for a local squid festival

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his 900-mile road trip from Venice to Istanbul, sampling that array of gastronomic delights that lie on the route. In the penultimate episode Rick arrives in the Greek Peloponnese where he samples mouth-watering dishes such as rooster stew hilopites with mizithra cheese, and a home-made moussaka he claims is the best he have ever savoured. In his Symi island kitchen, Rick rolls up his sleeves to prepare galaktoboureko, a dessert of semolina custard in filo pastry, a favourite dish in Greece

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

programme.desc: Richard Ayoade takes on the worst of the British climate, braving a hurricane in a wind tunnel with the help of Tim Vine to assess the best in gust-busting gadgetry. He also cooks the countrys iconic dish sultans delight - a mouth-watering lamb stew on a bed of aubergine puree

But first he will have to impress the fearsome - and famously rude - host

Nick offers to clear out half their unwanted belongings and get a cut-price makeover

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Huntingdon, Cambridgeshire, to transform the home of mother-of-three Julie Jones, who made the news when she vowed to raise her dying friends five children. With the help of the local community, the crew aims to create a comfortable living environment for Julies newly expanded family, and have just 10 days to finish the build

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team come to the aid of a couple in Worksop, Nottinghamshire, who started out building their own extension to meet the needs of their growing family, only to receive a double blow when husband Neil was made redundant and their youngest child Ben began to show signs of autism. The builders have just 10 days to bring designer Gabrielle Blackmans ideas to life - but as usual, local tradesmen and other members of the community turn out in force to help

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Fareham, Hampshire, to help Haanagh and Mike, who have three children, including twins - one with cerebral palsy, the other profoundly deaf. The family house is small and the cramped conditions are making life difficult, and at times dangerous, for the growing boys. Local tradespeople and members of the community muck in to help the builders create a new single-storey extension in just nine days, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to protect her vision

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: Its the Semi-Final, featuring the ultimate service challenge as the chefs cook a three-course menu of their own design, hoping to secure their spot in the Grand Finale

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.sub-title: Terri, Esme and the Chi Family
programme.desc: Pete meets Lurcher Terri, whos terrified of the world and must learn to trust again, and helps settle a family of chihuahuas given up by their heartbroken owner

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Shooting Joe Exotic
programme.desc: Louis revisits his 2011 documentary Americas Most Dangerous Pets, returning to Oklahoma to explore what has happened since. Joe Exotic, aka Joseph Allen Maldonado-Passage, now resides in a federal prison after being found guilty of a murder-for-hire plot and multiple animal cruelty charges, and having been the subject of hit Netflix documentary Tiger King

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: When Marion, 30, and Rachel, 32, wanted to start a family they went in search of a sperm donor and ended up with twins, but at their 30-week scan, the couple are told one of the babies is not growing properly and they must return to Southmead Hospital the next day for a C-section. Image-conscious Sarah, 28, and her husband, 40-year-old personal trainer Rob, reach a compromise over baby names in the delivery suite, while 39-year-old Ollie arrives armed with blankets, rugs and all the essentials to make sure his expectant wife, 33-year-old Kate, is as comfortable as possible

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Emma Bunton visits Southmead Hospital to support the maternity units charity, and her arrival causes quite a stir, with midwife Sacha bringing in some treasured Spice Girls memorabilia to get signed. Meanwhile, expectant mum Tina must decide whether she has a future with her partner, and Sarahs labour progresses quickly, but she cant get in touch with her husband. Catherine and Phillip, who met online, eagerly await the start of their family life together

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The contestants pair up to redesign cafes in the seaside town of Margate, with each person responsible for their own zone. One team decide that art deco is the way to go and choose a very bold colour palette, inspired by one of Margates most famous artists, JW Turner. The other team channel the colours of the sea with cool blues and vintage shutters to create a laid-back feel. But which one will impress Michelle Ogundehin and guest judge Ross Bailey the most? Presented by Alan Carr

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: The presenter travels to Mersea Island in Essex to help a family of six who are drowning in clutter and in need of a cut-price makeover. Dad Lee, along with grown-up sons Ben and Jake, run a house-clearance business. However, instead of disposing of items or selling them on, Lee brings bits back to the family home just in case he might need them. To make matters worse, mum Joanne and twin daughters Amy and Annabel have a passion for charity shop clothes. Nicks team transfers all the familys possessions to a village hall before embarking on that makeover

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Ever since suffering a brain infection four years ago, Sunderland woman June Findlay has been unable to walk or talk and is totally dependent on her devoted husband John. Since then she has been sleeping on a hospital bed in the kitchen, with no washing or toilet facilities. Joan and John do their best, but Nick Knowles believes they deserve better, so he and his small band of builders - bolstered by an army of local tradespeople - set out to extend the Findlays home, with designer Oliver Heath on hand to protect his vision. Can they give June back her dignity?

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Two years ago, Michelle and Rod Malone set about adapting their home after daughter Maddie contracted a rare brain disease that left her struggling to walk and talk. However, unforeseen problems with the project left them living in just a couple of rooms in an unsafe house. Enter Nick Knowles and the DIY SOS builders, bolstered by an army of local tradespeople, to complete what the Malones started and give it a few finishing touches, courtesy of flamboyant designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team meet Rob and Michelle Wall and their son Noah. The couple live in a small 18th-century house in Cumbria, which is currently a half-finished renovation project that had to be put on hold when Noah was born with spina bifida. Designer Charlie Luxton is tasked with making the cold and unsafe property a special haven for the family - and as always an army of local tradesmen turn out in force to help make the dream a reality

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: The finalists must cook a dish using a classic ingredient pairing, followed by an epic final Pressure Test, before the winner is announced

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The discovery of underwear on a canal bank sparks a risky missing persons search and a police incident ends in a fleeing car passenger jumping over a wall and breaking his leg

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A major fire breaks out in a haulage depot in Brighouse and a serious accident at an illegal off-road biking site leads to a rider needing urgent hospital treatment

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Childhood pals Edina and Patsy have a bitter bust-up and set out to find new best friends. Acclaimed comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, with guest appearances by Britt Ekland, Lulu and Zandra Rhodes

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edinas ex-husband Marshall threatens to cut off her alimony payments, throwing her into a panic over how she is going to survive without regular deliveries of groceries from Harrods. Comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Patsy and Edina have a rebirthing experience in the living room after setting the kitchen alight. Comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders and Joanne Lumley

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The three semi-finalists upgrade lakeside holiday lodges in the heart of the Cotswolds, each of which includes an open-plan kitchen, living and dining space and an outside terrace. The buildings are decidedly beige, giving the designers a blank canvas to work on - and knowing they are only one week away from the final they really go to town, with schemes ranging from bold primary colours inspired by a classic 1980s movie to a sophisticated monochrome look. Michelle Ogundehin judges their efforts with help from designer Abigail Ahern

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden aims to bring a slice of Hollywood to Sicily with a banana leaf-patterned boudoir as she takes the reins designing the master bedroom. Alan Carr is concerned her camp theme is on the wrong side of tacky, so she takes him to visit one of Palermos most prestigious hotels to show how exuberant decor has enticed high-profile guests including famous composer Richard Wagner. To bring her vision to life, Amanda ropes in her DIY-loving father to help build a bespoke four-poster bed. Alan, meanwhile, learns to kick back like the Italians do, with a lesson in the art of doing nothing

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins a new journey on the tracks of the Ocean line to explore Canadas maritime provinces, en route to Quebec City. Along the way he dons a kilt and sporran to join in the recreation of an 18th-century Scottish Highland regiment and learns of a catastrophic explosion in Halifax harbour in 1917, which killed 2,000 people and left 25,000 homeless

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey to Quebec City, beginning by boarding the train from Nova Scotia to New Brunswick. Along the way he investigates the worlds biggest tide at Hopewell Rocks and admires its dramatic rock formations and caves. He also appears to defy gravity on a magnetic hill in a 1965 Pontiac Bonneville, before joining the Elsipogtog First Nation to learn about quilting and traditional dress. He also goes fishing for oysters and helps quarry 150-year-old sandstone

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Where are the missing billions? Exploring the tunnels, lakes, and secret caches used by the Nazis to hide spoils of war

programme.title: The Great War in Numbers
programme.desc: How the First World War transformed life on the home front, from a greater number of women in the workplace to increased government interference in everyday life

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Ightham Mote, a medieval manor near Sevenoaks. Objects brought in to be valued include a set of hold and porcelain false teeth from the 1850s, which triggers a grim look back at the history of dentures. Plus, Walter Scotts walking cane, and two cricket bats dating back to the 18th century

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second show from Ightham Mote near Sevenoaks, where finds include a gold ring containing a lock of Lord Byrons hair, a collection of postcards from 1916 that reveal how a British PoW sent messages to his family, and a pair of Chinese paintings that make a big impression on specialist David Battie

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A series of head-turning supercharged cars head to the Mathewsons auction room. Plus, going under Dereks hammer - a Ford Escort XR3 and a beautiful MGA

programme.desc: Derek heads out to pick up a pair of beautiful Swedish models - a Saab 96L and a Volvo P1800ES. Plus, a rare British AC Aceca comes up for sale

programme.title: Colombia with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer explores the country as 50 years of civil war draws to a close in the wake of a recently signed peace deal. He meets guerrilla fighters who have pledged to lay down arms, but also discovers a negative consequence of their disarming, as the paramilitary gangs that control the drugs trade grow in power. Simon travels through the country with coca farmers, who discuss the government support they will need in the turbulent times ahead, as poverty and land ownership becoming pressing issues

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The Restos team try their hardest not to go too far on an Opel Manta. And a Peugeot 205 GTI brings back happy B-road memories for a mechanic who owned one

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus splash out £550 on a garage owners Mercedes 190. Its previous owner has failed to fix it, but the duo are more confident

programme.desc: A series of head-turning supercharged cars head to the Mathewsons auction room. Plus, going under Dereks hammer - a Ford Escort XR3 and a beautiful MGA

programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring Haludovo Palace Hotel in Croatia, Wolfs Lair, a German military complex and Herouni Mirror Radio Telescope - a pioneering facility in Armenia

programme.title: Colombia with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer explores the country as 50 years of civil war draws to a close in the wake of a recently signed peace deal. He meets guerrilla fighters who have pledged to lay down arms, but also discovers a negative consequence of their disarming, as the paramilitary gangs that control the drugs trade grow in power. Simon travels through the country with coca farmers, who discuss the government support they will need in the turbulent times ahead, as poverty and land ownership becoming pressing issues

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Province of Quebec, taking the Charlevoix train along the north bank of the St Lawrence River to La Malbaie. Along the way he flies over the Laurentian Mountains in a seaplane, fishes for trout and views the waterfall at Montmorency from a zipwire - and thats just the first half of this leg

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo strikes west across Manitoba into the province of Saskatchewan. High above the Prairie at Riding Mountain, he discovers how a middle-class British boy from Hastings transformed himself into an influential indigenous naturalist called Grey Owl. Deep in the Prairie, he finds a network of railways that once served the wheat farmers of Saskatchewan, and learns how communities grew up around the grain elevators used to load the crops on to rail wagons

programme.title: Sacred Rivers with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer returns with a series that takes him around the world to areas that cannot be fully appreciated without considering the vast influence of their rivers, and hes going to explain how those sacred rivers dont just simply flow through countries - they define them. Simon begins at the source of the worlds longest river, the Nile, and follows it out to sea, taking him from the Ethiopian highlands, through the desert of Sudan and then Egypt, right to the Mediterranean Sea. He also explains how the Nile has forged some of our earliest civilisations and influenced religions. However, the stability of the region looks uncertain, given that populations along its banks are growing, and Nile countries are demanding greater shares of the sacred waters

Can Joel overcome his second-place curse, will Tony and Coreys bickering get the better of them, and could Vickys past party lifestyle lead her and her mum to victory? Expect plenty of surprises that include Romeshs mum Shanthis method for getting away with murder

programme.desc: In July 2005, 18-year-old Anthony Walker was murdered by two white men in an unprovoked racist attack in a Liverpool park. Jimmy McGoverns drama imagines what life may have held for Anthony if the teenager had not been killed, with the reverse chronology seeing him realise his dreams and enjoy the life he had a right to before fate - and hate - took it all away. Toheeb Jimoh stars

programme.desc: A magistrate does his best to protect a young troublemaker - until an embarrassing connection between the two comes to light. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes

programme.desc: British vet Steve Leonard has a close encounter with a protective elephant and her calf as he continues his work with the wildlife team at the Erindi Game Reserve in the central highlands of Namibia. programme.sub-title: Oh! To Be in England - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Preparations get under way for the christening, while Primrose loses her heart to a very confused vicar. Rural drama, starring Gwen Taylor, Murray Head and Tricia Penrose

Bad news strikes a family when it emerges a couples son is showing signs of a hereditary heart disorder, a mother-to-be suffers kidney failure during childbirth and hospital porter Ken Hopkirk needs an operation after injuring himself while lifting a piano. Drama, starring David Lonsdale and Tricia Penrose

Goodwin fails to diagnose a serious case of post-natal depression - an error which almost ends in tragedy when the mother is found standing perilously close to a cliff edge - and student nurse Samantha Beaumont discovers she has an unexpected love rival. programme.desc: Dane Bowers plays mystery celebrity host to four strangers, who must decipher the clues and guess the DJ and pop stars correct identity to win the prize money and avoid having to wash up. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host the celebrity cooking contest as Kelly Holmes, Anne Hegerty, Ranj Singh and Maura Higgins take to the kitchen in head-to-head cooking battles as they each attempt to create the perfect Spanish dish and avoid elimination in the Cook Off. There is panic over tapas, an unfortunate meat burn, some dramatic croquettas and a wobble over a paella - will they manage to finish their Spanish dishes before the time runs out?

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Zulfi from Bolton, Mark from Deal, Imani from Leicester and Kelly from Cardiff pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot
